column5: Sharing a pic from this weekend of a silver laker caught in Kingscote Lake in Algonquin. Kinda cool looking and only found in this lake. First laker trolling from a canoe for me which made it extra special. 2 oz weight, small gang troll, chartreuse mepps.
That is really cool, they are every bit as unique as the Auroras, perhaps even more so.

I don't get on this forum as much anymore unfortunately but had to comment on your catch. I'm an avid lake trout fisherman and I have to say that's a beauty of a fish  , well done and thanks for sharing
Dammit... I have an aurora. , now I want one of those.   Cool fish
